item.title: When 3D isn’t enough
item.description: Exploring experiments that go beyond traditional 3D visuals, showing how depth and perception can be pushed in surprising ways.

media:content.media:title: When 3D isn’t enough
media:content.media:description: Exploring experiments that go beyond traditional 3D visuals, showing how depth and perception can be pushed in surprising ways.

item.title: Can light be black?
item.description: A fascinating experiment examining whether light can appear black and how materials interact with it

item.title: The dark truth about chips
item.description: This eye opening experiment reveals the dark truth about potato chips

item.title: Can a superconductor defy gravity?
item.description: Watch this mind-bending experiment as a superconductor levitates effortlessly, floating in mid-air like magic but it’s pure physics!

item.title: Perfect Oreo separation
item.description: This experiment tests different techniques to separate Oreo cookies without breaking the cream.

item.title: The forever pen
item.description: Discover the Forever Pen, a compact, inkless writing tool that uses a silver alloy tip to leave permanent marks on various surfaces

item.title: Stretch Armstrong vs. Vacuum chamber
item.description: Watch what happens when a Stretch Armstrong toy is placed in a vacuum chamber. See how it stretches, inflates, and reacts to the pressure changes in real time.

item.title: Photosynthesis in real time
item.description: Observe how plants convert light into energy in real time—this experiment captures gas exchange, color change, and growth as photosynthesis unfolds before your eyes.

item.title: Sending the internet through water
item.description: Exploring whether data signals can be transmitted through water using light or lasers, testing the limits of underwater internet tech.

item.title: The wheels of the future
item.description: This experiment showcases cutting-edge wheel designs and tests how they handle speed, terrain, and stability.

item.title: A true 3D display you can make with your smart phone
item.description: Making a real 3D display with a smart phone

item.title: Does a boat float in supercritical fluid? ​
item.description: This experiment tests how a boat behaves in a supercritical fluid, revealing surprising physics about density, buoyancy, and extreme states of matter.

item.title: Can we outrun electricity?
item.description: This experiment explores how fast electricity really travels and whether a human could ever beat it. A thrilling look at physics in action!

item.title: I made a Coca-Cola rocket
item.description: What happens when you mix pressure, physics, and Coca-Cola?

item.title: The machine that does nothing actually does something
item.description: In this video I show you the nothing machine and how it works. I talk about why it takes energy to hold a weight in place without moving it.

item.title: The brightest room
item.description: In this video I show you what it looked like when you paint an entire room with the world's brightest paint, called LIT. This is a continuation of the first video I did in which I painted my room with the darkest paint in the world (Musou Black). Watch how bright a room can glow on it's own!

item.title: Magic thirsty block
item.description: A special material that soaks up water like a sponge.

item.title: The science behind rocket fins
item.description: Exploring how rocket fins stabilize flight, control direction, and balance forces, revealing the essential physics behind safe and accurate rocket launches.

item.title: Reflecting a laser into itself
item.description: This experiment investigates the behavior of a laser beam when reflected back toward its source, revealing surprising effects with light and optics in a controlled setup.

item.title: Can helium-filled sneakers make you fly?
item.description: This fun experiment tests whether helium-filled shoes could make a person float.
